Award.AwardTitle: I-Corps: The Animal Diversity Web, a Resource for Learning and Teaching
Award.AbstractNarration:
This project seeks to further develop the Animal Diversity Web (ADW), which is a highly structured database of biological information about organisms, accumulated through the efforts of students in university classes across the country. Its structure allows researchers to build tools and services to support active inquiry and other educational resources. The structure of the database, its rich content, and its versatility in working in combination with other data sources has enabled the ADW team to provide high quality data in accessible formats.

The ADW has demonstrated success in teaching students how to think like scientists at both K-12 and undergraduate levels for over 15 years. As a result, the research team has a broad set of resources that are widely used. The ADW is one of the largest and most widely used biological databases worldwide, with over 2 million pages served to over 300,000 users monthly, as well as connections to a large network of K-12 and undergraduate educators involved in ADW projects. This large user base represents a tremendous asset as the research team explores further development of ADW products. Further development of the ADW has the potential to expand both science-education as well as public understanding of science.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Animal Diversity Web (ADW, animaldiversity.org) is a globally recognized educational resource with an excellent reputation for quality of information. The ADW serves half a million users monthly through our website. But the ADW is more than a website, it is a structured database known for technological innovation. This means that the ADW can create custom collections of the data and produce media-rich digital education and engagement products – such as customized mobile guides, print on demand products, and educational activities. This serves a unique and potentially huge education market for site or purpose specific collections of data to inform ature engagement and outreach activities globally.

 With NSF I-Corps funding, the ADW has successfully completed all of the necessary steps to transforming the ADW research project into a viable business capable of generating sustainable revenue. The ADW team completed the I-Corps training program, pursued several rounds of customer discovery, designed an exciting business strategy, developed functional products, and is currently seeking seed investment to complete product development and go to market.

ADW has developed a mobile app framework that allows us to create beautiful, professional mobile guides that are customized to the species and natural features of a particular place. We can provide these products at competitive prices and there is no other organization that can readily create these excellent, data-driven products with animal information. Our competitive advantage is that there is no other resource like the ADW and that we can readily create custom engagement products for parks, museums, zoos, and other organizations of any size and anywhere in the world.

Even with relatively modest growth projections, we can generate profits in year three and our global scale suggests substantial return on investment.

 We have a solid technical and leadership team with 20 years of experience in building databases and exploring innovative ways to use data in support of education. Our team leaders have well-established relationships with potential database partners as we grow and we have some excellent and enthusiastic advisors. With investment, we will build our team to include more expertise in business operations and marketing and aggressively enter the custom nature engagement market with our mobile products. Additional products will also be pursued as we begin to generate revenue, including print on demand products and educational services for formal and informal audiences.

We are transforming an unparalleled global information resource into a business that will enhance opportunities for nature engagement in a substantial new market niche.
